alert.note: Alert for Mingo (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 12:35AM EST until February 18 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky...West Virginia... Tug Fork River At Williamson affecting Mingo, Martin and Pike Counties. For the Tug Fork River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tug Fork River At Williamson. * WHEN...Until late this morning. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, The Water treatment plant flood gate in Williamson is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 28.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 AM EST Saturday was 28.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will slowly fall, falling below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.3 feet on 01/22/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1100 AM EST.
